body_html:
I agree with your explanation of what I am doing (wrong choice of words on my end).
I also agree with your analogy. However, it's because it's analogous that I made this mistake.
I am not saying that it's a bug, but I think it can be a bit puzzling the first time you look at it, and that is why I was suggesting to throw a warning when reassigning a placeholder because it is going to lead to an unwanted behavior.

I also agree with your general comment on naming ops.

I also agree with your analogy. However, it's because it's analogous that I made this mistake.

I also agree with your general comment on naming ops.
body:
I agree with your explanation of what I am doing (wrong choice of words on my end). 
I also agree with your analogy. However, it's because it's analogous that I made this mistake.
I am not saying that it's a bug, but I think it can be a bit puzzling the first time you look at it, and that is why I was suggesting to throw a warning when reassigning a placeholder because it is going to lead to an unwanted behavior.

I also agree with your general comment on naming ops.
